summary.p: Gast can forward letters intended for Gilbert [Cousin] through his brother [Antoine Cousin?], who will come to [Basel] next week. Gast wonders why Bullinger has not written to Cousin. - He sends [„In primum Musculi Anticochlaeum Replica brevis“] by [Johannes] Cochläus. Bullinger will consider whether this writing is worthy of a response. - The followers of Bucer are very displeased with the [„Warhaffte Bekanntnuß“ or the „Orthodoxa Tigurinae ecclesiae confessio“ of the Zurichers] against Luther. - Greetings to Theodor [Bibliander]. - [P.S.:] The [Zurichers] will promptly receive a barrel with letters and books.

div.p: Greetings. I will forward the letters sent to Mr. Gilbert through my brother, who will come to us next week, and I wonder why you have not written back to him, as he eagerly awaits your letters.
Here is the book by Cochläus. Whether it is worthy of a response, you will see. The arrogant man will never submit to the truth, as is apparent from his writings.
The followers of Bucer are very displeased with your Apology against Luther. Farewell to you and all yours.
I pray for the well-being of Mr. Theodor, an excellent man.
You will immediately receive a barrel with letters and books.
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, my ever-honored teacher. Zurich.
